intro: Secamone pedicellaris, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. Its roots and stems are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical features of Secamone pedicellaris make it an interesting subject for both ecological and pharmacological studies.
